types.html:
déviarger

  1. (Quebec, vulgar) to destroy or damage; to hurt physically;
    • 1936 June 11, Adolphe Nantel, “À la hache”, in Le Progrès du Saguenay‎[1], volume 49, number 32, page 2:
      Et Ferdinand, tout comme son employé hier: — "Tabarnac", commis, on te l’déviarge, le ch’min ! Il a raison, cent fois raison...
      & Ferdinand, just like his employee yesterday. "Fuck, clerk, we're diverting your fucking path!" He's right, he's absolutely right...
  2. (Quebec, vulgar) to deflower a virgin

Conjugation

[edit]

title: déviarger
pronunHtml:
• IPA(key): /de.vjaʁ.ʒe/
  • Rhymes: -e
